comment.author: 38557729@N08
comment._content: This photo reminds me of the Ship & Sanitary Canal which ran through such towns as Lemont, Illinois.

comment.author: 18848263@N06
comment._content: This image is a companion to the last one I commented on only it is taken from the south bank of the Drainage Canl looking to the N/W - Willow Springs.  It appears to be from the East side fo the old steel bridge over the canal on Willow Springs Rd.

comment.author: 93265881@N08
comment._content: Sunlight is coming from left, so I think he turned around and took a pic from the south bank, looking SW. Also, the high power lines run on the south bank of the I&M canal, but they may have been moved. I know, theres no bridge, but maybe the photograhper is under it, or walked past it so it wasnt in the shot.  Also, the canal appears to curve right in the distance, which both canals do SW of the the Willow Springs Road Bridge

comment.author: 18848263@N06
comment._content: You are correct, I don't know why I put that N/W direction up on my last post.  Yes the photographer is still on the south bank.  He walked under the WSR bridge and shot this looking S/W .  Those electric supply lines are the wires running from the power plant down stream.  The Sanitary District was selling electric power to villages in those days.  The power lines run/ran between the ship canal and the I&M back then.  There were poles along the south bank of the I&M canal but those are long gone - though some of the stumps are still around.
